result.execSummary:
The defendant James V King II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any other case; Huber privileges for work and childcare
Sign up for probation no later than 10-28-2022

miscConds.notes: Submit a DNA sample by 10/28/2022 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept. Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
- Complete a Cognitive Intervention Course.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James V King II

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James V King II in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for James V King II.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a plea and sentencing hearing. Parties held negotiations off the record.  

Negotiations placed on the record. Upon the motion of the County. Court ordered charge amended to Obstructing an Officer, Sec. 946.41(1), Wis. Stats., to which Defendant plead no contest. Defendant found guilty of amended charge. 

AS TO COUNT ONE; Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    

AS TO COUNT ONE; Defendant ordered to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 0 days time served, Huber Privileges for work and childcare. CONSEQUTIVE TO ANY OTHER CASE. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

- Sign up for probation no later than 10/28/2022.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Obtain/maintain full time work.
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
- Complete a cognitive intervention course.
- Complete 25 hours of community service.
- Submit a DNA sample by 10/28/2022 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.

Defendant James V King II in Court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in Court for James V King II.  Attorney Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the County of Milwaukee. 

Case in Court for Status Conference. Defendant has FIVE Cases pending in Branch 15: 22TR17253, 22TR17254, 22TR17255, 22FO627, and 22CM1662. Discussion placed on the record. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Defense (Attorney Corey R. Flynn - represents Defendant on 22CM1662) requested a plea/sentencing hearing. Court granted request. State to comply with Victim Notification. Court ordered case adjourned for Plea/Sentencing hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 15.

Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court, defendant James V King not in court, in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Discussion held off the record. Defense in receipt of discovery and offer and request time to review and discuss with the defendant. 
Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.
Scheduling conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

ADDRESS INFO for James V King II
Current: 5544 N 41st Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 06-29-2022)
Prior: 4440 North 58th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218

Defendant James V King in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Defendant James V King in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.
This hearing may be streamed live through DACAST at the Court's discretion:   https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
